doc.after: Horseshoe Curve is on the Pittsburgh Line, the Norfolk Southern Railway Pittsburgh Division main line between Pittsburgh and Harrisburg, Pennsylvania. Westbound trains climb a maximum grade of 1.85Â percent for 12 miles (19Â km) from Altoona to Gallitzin;[2] just west of the Gallitzin Tunnels trains pass the summit of the Allegheny Mountains, then descend for 25 miles (40Â km) to Johnstown on a grade of 1.1Â percent or less.[2]
